The Inverse Gaussian distribution

Source: R/dist_inverse_gaussian.R
dist_inverse_gaussian.Rd

dist_inverse_gaussian(mean, shape)

Arguments

mean

parameters. Must be strictly positive. Infinite values are supported.

shape

parameters. Must be strictly positive. Infinite values are supported.

See also

actuar::InverseGaussian

Examples

dist <- dist_inverse_gaussian(mean = c(1,1,1,3,3), shape = c(0.2, 1, 3, 0.2, 1))
dist
#> <distribution[5]>
#> [1] IG(1, 0.2) IG(1, 1)   IG(1, 3)   IG(3, 0.2) IG(3, 1)  

mean(dist)
#> [1] 1 1 1 3 3
variance(dist)
#> [1]   5.0000000   1.0000000   0.3333333 135.0000000  27.0000000
support(dist)
#> <support_region[5]>
#> [1] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf]
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 0.12450911 0.09180806 2.57169811 0.40267175 0.14926837 1.93951028
#>  [7] 0.05297030 1.62249529 0.21148558 0.11206930
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 0.4922388 1.8251066 0.3901320 0.7756328 0.1486772 0.4257678 0.9898083
#>  [8] 0.1619033 0.7901724 1.4668386
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] 0.7684920 0.3590928 0.7176667 2.9774089 1.2792971 2.1369712 1.1189581
#>  [8] 0.8665607 0.4355114 4.3792377
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1]  1.82706963  0.10934324 14.97073051  0.08962026  0.25440520  0.11327198
#>  [7]  1.09548245  0.29272419  0.02240544  0.26239088
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1]  0.2971676  0.8293304  8.6085965  3.2334136  2.5691906  0.6021790
#>  [7]  1.0684004 14.8610614  0.6603685  0.1643695
#> 

density(dist, 2)
#> [1] 0.06000195 0.10984782 0.11539974 0.06272885 0.13718333
density(dist, 2, log = TRUE)
#> [1] -2.813378 -2.208659 -2.159353 -2.768934 -1.986437

cdf(dist, 4)
#> [1] 0.9454196 0.9790764 0.9983186 0.8735512 0.8031695

quantile(dist, 0.7)
#> [1] 0.6758386 1.0851197 1.1505484 1.0143030 2.5216357
